channel.title: Wireless internet not working
channel.description:
I think when i asked for help last time about my wrt54gs i NEVER mentioned me wanting to connect wireless. Im on the internet now with ubuntu because i have a Ethernet to my sisters laptop using her internet. So i can do things faster and get packages and stuff.
But yes, using a WRT54GS Linksys router.
If you need additional info please just ask.
[Still need help]
[hr]
How can i lower the effects so that i can move smoothly through the compiz cube? The effects lags me with normal tasks like dragging windows, and scrolling in firefox, and i have all the effects disabled. im just wondering if theres a check box i have on that is doing something that isn't necessary and making me lag
it may be a gfx card problem since im using XGL rather than my ATI driver, does anyone know how i could get my ATI driver up and running with compiz?
EDIT: Got it! LINUX FUCKING PWNS.

item.title: Wireless internet not working
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:62, topic:237700”][quote author=Frell link=topic=313842.msg2506391#msg2506391 date=1224947929]
ubuntu partitioned my hardrive and screwed up my hardware trying to remove everything, we need to get my laptop sent in to be fixed now. lulz
[/quote]HAHAHAHAHA

You’re just a noob, tbh.[/quote]
Yea, we didnt know that ubuntu didnt ‘delete’ the files, it moved them. so right when we were done formatting the c: drive it asked us about x, and then we found out it was recovs and shit. Doesnt matter though, i wanted to get vista off of there, i’d rather have xp.

We might not have to get it sent in, its just not detecting my wireless card.

Read full topic

item.title: Wireless internet not working
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:59, topic:237700”][quote author=Frell link=topic=313842.msg2506391#msg2506391 date=1224947929]
ubuntu partitioned my hardrive and screwed up my hardware trying to remove everything, we need to get my laptop sent in to be fixed now. lulz
[/quote]
bullshit, repartitioning a hard drive back to it’s original state is easy, and there is no way it would screw up your hardware.[/quote]
I put Ubuntu in my D: Drive, and it moved all my recovs to X, but we didnt find this out until we formated my D and C drive.

There was nothing wrong with ubuntu itself, its the location i put it in.

Read full topic

item.title: Wireless internet not working
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

On another topic

Install Linux on it.

Im using ubuntu…

Anyway, im going to try windows 2003 on virtualbox since 2003 doesnt use as much cpu and it will still run c4d and other simple programs.

EDIT:Fuck my internet isnt working again. VB screwed something up and i got a white screen when i tried to login, so i did a recovery and now im back to no wireless settings… I completely forgot what i did to get it to work and i reviewed the thread and still nothing…

Got it… started working out of the blue… again

Read full topic

item.title: Wireless internet not working
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:51, topic:237700”][quote author=Frell link=topic=313842.msg2503043#msg2503043 date=1224793553]

first install fluxbox, its a window manager that takes up little cpu/memory

then install vmware which is virtual pc software and install windows on your virtual computer and then run cinema4d

I tried that but the other way around, on windows i used virtualbox to install ubuntu and it was slow as fuck. Does that mean it will be slow?

I got fluxbox, but vmware isnt free and it wants me to register with an email domain that isnt free??? should i just torrent it?
[/quote]
yes or you could use sun’s freen VM. Just google it or search the forums b/c there was a thread on it.[/quote]
im wondering what one will lag less on my 2G RAM laptop

Read full topic

item.title: Wireless internet not working
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:42, topic:237700”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=313842.msg2502032#msg2502032 date=1224722950]
So your card worked from the beginning, you just didn’t know how to connect it to the network?
[/quote]
Most likely. Ubuntu is very confusing at first glance because it isnt as easy as windows. Windows would find the wireless networks at startup, while on ubuntu you have to enable it. But i still like linux much more Is there any ways to run .exes on linux? I saw .kabooms desktop and he had .exes on it.[/quote]

Ubuntu is as easy as windows, it’s just different so those who are used to windows will have to learn how to use Ubuntu, just as they learned how to use windows.

Read full topic
